It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it produces seeds in small, capsule-like structures. Schizoglossum zernyi is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
